TopicTitle: A simple plain MANLY Mun landing

Articles.Content:
In this challenge i want to see someone simply make it to the Mun, no part restrictions except use only stock parts and no other restriction except you can only be i cockpit view! ,No map, no MecJeb and no maneuver nodes! I would love to see vids and pics of your wonderful adventure to the Mun!

Rules:

You can only use cockpit view!

You must get to the Mun and back without taking any damage!

No mods!

No maneuver nodes!

Player who dose it fastest wins, please post pics of your Mun landing, and a pic of your kerban landing and a pic of your ship on the launch pad!

the winner wins $50000 imaginary dollars!

Debug consul is not aloud

First score board! (so far)

1st place: Aphobius with 12:26:50

2nd place: Oxytropis with 1:17:39:08

Congrats so far! Looking forward to more posts!

Edited November 2, 2013 by krona14
You should really call this "Manley mode landing"
It can be done, but not in a "scientific" way, since you miss a lot of vital data (I think you can't even see the altitude while you are in the cockpit).
You got pretty much information at cockpit view.

Except the altitude. =)) (joking, you miss much more)

Maybe I'm wrong about the altitude, but I don't know how you would read altitudes over 100km on that altimeter (I'm not home so I can't check it).

Well, OP....can I press the "M" for map view?

If not, that will be pretty hard.

If yes, that will be super easy.

He said it already.

"You can only use cockpit view!"

Ok, we spam this topic too much, I'll post an entry a little later, after I get home, I can do it pretty easily, but it's going to be very "kerbal".

Make sure and switch it to 1080p. Video is 2x speed to stay under the 15min YouTube restrictions.

Edited November 2, 2013 by Oxytropis
If you bind your science experiments to an action group, you can still get science despite being in IVA.

Do what Manley did: run through it several times using all the other views until you can do it without maneuver nodes, and then until you can do it without map view. Write down all the burn times and durations while you're at it so you have a reference when you're in the cockpit view.

Watch Manley's video closely; he didn't do that without preparation.

Do what Manley did: run through it several times using all the other views until you can do it without maneuver nodes, and then until you can do it without map view. Write down all the burn times and durations while you're at it so you have a reference when you're in the cockpit view.

Watch Manley's video closely; he didn't do that without preparation.

That's to much work, just do it once viewing normally to get a feel for it, then do it. The only thing you have to remember from your first run is the speed you need to be going to reach the Mun and your heading, and neither has to be dead on exact for the mun.

Edited November 2, 2013 by Oxytropis
Thanks Oxytropis for the first submission, i cant wait to see more, i wait to about 5-10 before i give the scores. and ill keep scoring beyond that if more people show up!

Except the altitude. =)) (joking, you miss much more)

Maybe I'm wrong about the altitude, but I don't know how you would read altitudes over 100km on that altimeter (I'm not home so I can't check it).

All manned pods have an altimeter, and I'm pretty sure it takes the altitude from ground level rather than sea level. You read altitudes above 100km by looking out the window and determining how far away from something you are, then comparing it to the altitude reading. If you're beyond 100km then unless you're trying to do an IVA-only mission to Jool it doesn't really matter.

Ok, as promised:

Entry (or whatever xD this is not serious)

I've streamed it on twitch earlier, evil people, no one told me that my microphone is making that noise, my voice is annoying anyway, you can mute it. It was the second time I was explaining it, so the explanations are not complete, so you better mute it.

You can start the scoreboard, my time seems to be 12:26:50. But you'll have a surprise if anyone tries to beat me.

EDIT: To make it a little more interesting would be nice to add a new rule, to require to land on ground, without any damage. Crashing randomly on the dark side of Kerbin is a little obnoxious.
